intro: Erigeron quattuordomuum, commonly known as the four-leaf erigeron, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It has fine, hairy leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Erigeron quattuordomuum is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
